fenics_mpm.gridmodel module¶

class fenics_mpm.gridmodel.GridModel(mesh, out_dir='./output/', verbose=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

Representation of the model on a finite-element grid.

Parameters:
  • out_dir (string) – directory to save results, defalult is ./output/.
  • mesh (Mesh) – the finite-element mesh.
assign_variable(u, var)[source]¶

Manually assign the values from var to u. The parameter var may be a string pointing to the location of an XDMFFile, HDF5File, or an xml file.

Parameters:
  • u (Function, GenericVector, Constant, float, int) – FEniCS Function assigning to
  • var (float, int, Expression, Constant, GenericVector, string, HDF5File, ndarray) – value assigning from
  • annotate – allow dolfin_adjoint annotation
color()[source]¶

The color used for printing messages to the screen.

Return type:string
generate_function_spaces(order=1, use_periodic=False)[source]¶

Generates the finite-element function spaces used with topological dimension \(d\) set by variable self.top_dim.

Parameters:
  • order – order \(k\) of the shape function, currently only supported are Lagrange \(P_1\) elements.
  • use_periodic (bool) – use periodic boundaries along lateral boundary (currently not supported).

The element shape-functions available from this method are :

  • self.Q – \(\mathcal{H}^k(\Omega)\)
  • self.Q3 – \([\mathcal{H}^k(\Omega)]^3\)
  • self.V – \([\mathcal{H}^k(\Omega)]^d\) formed using VectorFunctionSpace()
  • self.T – \([\mathcal{H}^k(\Omega)]^{d \times d}\) formed using TensorFunctionSpace()
initialize_variables()[source]¶

Initialize the model variables to default values. The variables defined here are:

Various things :

  • self.element – the finite-element
  • self.top_dim – the topological dimension
  • self.dofmap – DofMap for converting between vertex to nodal indicies
  • self.h – Cell diameter formed by calling CellDiameter() with self.mesh

Grid velocity vector \(\mathbf{u}_i = [u\ v\ w]^{\intercal}\):

  • self.U_mag – velocity vector magnitude
  • self.U3 – velocity vector
  • self.u – \(x\)-component of velocity vector
  • self.v – \(y\)-component of velocity vector
  • self.w – \(z\)-component of velocity vector

Grid acceleration vector \(\mathbf{a}_i = [a_x\ a_y\ a_z]^{\intercal}\):

  • self.a_mag – acceleration vector magnitude
  • self.a3 – acceleration vector
  • self.a_x – \(x\)-component of acceleration vector
  • self.a_y – \(y\)-component of acceleration vector
  • self.a_z – \(z\)-component of acceleration vector

Grid internal force vector \(\mathbf{f}_i^{\mathrm{int}} = [f_x^{\mathrm{int}}\ f_y^{\mathrm{int}}\ f_z^{\mathrm{int}}]^{\intercal}\):

  • self.f_int_mag – internal force vector magnitude
  • self.f_int – internal force vector
  • self.f_int_x – \(x\)-component of internal force vector
  • self.f_int_y – \(y\)-component of internal force vector
  • self.f_int_z – \(z\)-component of internal force vector

Grid mass \(m_i\):

  • self.m – mass \(m_i\)
  • self.m0 – inital mass \(m_i^0\)
save_pvd(u, name, f=None, t=0.0)[source]¶

Save a XDMFFile with name name of the Function u to the xdmf directory specified by self.out_dir.

If f is a XDMFFile object, save to this instead.

If t is a float or an int, mark the file with the timestep t.

Parameters:
  • u (Function or GenericVector) – the function to save
  • name – the name of the .xdmf file to save
  • f (XDMFFile) – the file to save to
  • t (int or float) – the timestep to mark the file with
save_xdmf(u, name, f=None, t=0.0)[source]¶

Save a XDMFFile with name name of the Function u to the xdmf directory specified by self.out_dir.

If f is a XDMFFile object, save to this instead.

If t is a float or an int, mark the file with the timestep t.

Parameters:
  • u (Function or GenericVector) – the function to save
  • name – the name of the .xdmf file to save
  • f (XDMFFile) – the file to save to
  • t (int or float) – the timestep to mark the file with
set_boundary_conditions(boundary_subdomains, boundary_values)[source]¶

Update the grid acceleration \(\mathbf{a}_i = [a_x\ a_y\ a_z]^{\intercal}\), self.a3 to parameter a.

Parameters:a (list of Functions) – grid acceleration
update_internal_force_vector(f_int)[source]¶

Update the grid acceleration \(\mathbf{f}_i^{\mathrm{int}} = [f_x^{\mathrm{int}}\ f_y^{\mathrm{int}}\ f_z^{\mathrm{int}}]^{\intercal}\) to paramter f_int.

Parameters:f_int (list of Functions) – grid internal force
update_mass(m)[source]¶

Update the grid mass \(m_i\), self.m to parameter m.

Parameters:m (Function,) – grid mass
